name: Is taxation theft?
description: A simple exploration of a tax system in a non-voluntaryist society.
assumptions:
• Non-compliance will result in actions that include the following:
    1. You may find your property, and wages taken from you.
    2. You may find your movement and life constrained to a limited sized cage.
    3. You may find your life removed from you by execution or murder.
  • Enforcers of the following will be people who are wearing matching uniforms.
  • You may seek arbitration, but it will only be through the same organization that enforces compliance.

questions.question: If I force money from you, is that theft?

buttons.label: Yes
buttons.selectedComment: This was a trick question for the purpose of determining if you should continue.

buttons.label: No
buttons.selectedComment: Are you kidding? Stop right there. You have a mental deficiency, and the rest of the test is not applicable to you.

questions.question:
If I force money from you,
  • I have a written note permitting me to do so,
Is that theft?

buttons.label: Yes
buttons.selectedComment: You have just stated that written laws are not enough to justify theft.

buttons.label: No
buttons.selectedComment: So you think a bank robber passing a note to a bank teller to empty their cash drawers is legitamate.

questions.question:
If I force money from you, and:
  • I have a written note permitting me to do so,
  • Signed by multiple people,
is that theft?

buttons.label: Yes
buttons.selectedComment: You have just stated that gangs, politicians, and mob bosses may not steal.

buttons.label: No
buttons.selectedComment: So a gang, may demand money from you, as long as their gang boss told them to, and you are alright with that.

questions.question:
If I force money from you, and:
  • I have a written note permitting me to do so,
  • Signed by multiple people,
    • Part of the money collected is used to pay me to take money from other people,
is that theft?

buttons.label: Yes
buttons.selectedComment: This means that you believe that extorting money from one person, to pay for extortion against another person is still wrong. You are moral person.

buttons.label: No
buttons.selectedComment: So you want to pay me to steal from your neighbors too. Are you kidding me?

questions.question:
If I force money from you, and:
  • I have a written note permitting me to do so,
  • Signed by multiple people,
  • Part of the money collected is used to pay me to take money from other people,
  • Multiple people are equialy victimized by this rule,
is that theft?

buttons.label: Yes
buttons.selectedComment: So you have stated that theft from your community is as bad as theft from you.

buttons.label: No
buttons.selectedComment: So, it is OK, as long as your neighbors are stolen from too?
